comments:
Build: I-20040317

I shut down my workspace and I wanted to restart.
When I launched Eclipse with my usual -data arg, I got an error dialog saying:
"Error occurred in runtime.  Workspace cannot be set.  Exiting."

Wassim, the error in the log entries is actually the resulting of shutting down.
So it seems you are facing a problem during startup, which is causing the
platform to shutdown abruptly (and that is causing another exception).

The actual problem that is preventing you from starting may be being logged in
the wrong place (configuration area). See bug 51268.

Original summary was: "Cannot launch Eclipse".

There was a problem with java.langErrors being thrown by the application not
being logged by the framework/runtime. This has been fixed for M8. So, whatever
the reason why the application was crashing is, you will get it in the log.
Also, the call that caused a NPE in InternalPlatform.stop is not being done anymore.
*** Bug 55959 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Restoring original summary (what a mess)... 

I saw this as well (failing to start when there is no other instance of Eclipse
on the same workspace). Cannot tell the reason it failed, though. Maybe a
duplicate of bug 55511?

The problem with lack of proper logging is addressed in bug 55959.

bug 55511 is more about the content of the message rather than the reason the 
message is shown.

The problem here is very unclear.  The stacktrace shows a problem we had in 
shutdown but has been fixed.  Again however, that is just a symptom of whatever 
the real problem is (the one that is causing eclipse to exit).  

We are also improving the logging story so that we get more/better information 
in these cases.

Without more info we can't do much about this incident.

Closing
